item.title: [Dementhium 639] Dialogue
item.dc:creator: @tyb97 tyb97
item.description:
@tyb97 wrote:

This isn’t as complicated as you think. At the top of your file where all the ints and such are just add,
public boolean didQuest;

Then where your quest starts, put if(!didQuest) {
at the end of your quest, put didQuest = true; Then he can not start it again, I have also noticed your quest is strung tightly around the dialogue class, I suggest making a handler to handle your quests.

Read full topic

@tyb97 wrote:

Make a boolean didQuest, and in the beginning, put if(!didQuest) { and at the end of the quest, put didQuest = true;

item.title: [Dementhium 639] Dialogue
item.dc:creator: @wildskiller wildskiller
item.description:
@wildskiller wrote:

Alright so I am making a small quest to get 50k exp in 4 skills but I don’t know how to make it so people cannot do the quest again

Here’s my quest

case 8539: // Queen of snow if (player.getInventory().contains(14596, 1)) { player.getInventory().deleteItem(14596, 1); sendDialogue(player, HAPPY_TALKING, 8539, 15100, "Oh! Thank you! I will give you 50k exp", "in 1 of 4 skills of your choice."); } else sendDialogue(player, SAD, 8539, 15000, "What do you want?"); return true;

case 15000: sendOptionDialogue(player, new int[]{15200, -1}, "You seem sad, whats wrong?", "Nothing"); return true; case 15200: sendDialogue(player, CONFUSED, -1, 15001, "You seem sad, whats wrong?"); return true; case 15001: sendDialogue(player, SAD, 8539, 15002, "A pack of Elvargs ran off with my amulet"); return true; case 15002: sendOptionDialogue(player, new int[]{15300, 15400}, "Well I can help you.", "Seems like a you problem."); return true; case 15300: sendDialogue(player, HAPPY_TALKING, -1, 15003, "Well I can help you."); return true; case 15400: sendDialogue(player, HAPPY_TALKING, -1, -1, "Seems like a you problem."); return true; case 15003: sendDialogue(player, HAPPY_TALKING, 8539, 15004, "That's wonderful, the Elvargs are south of lumbridge in the", "swamp, I could teleport you there"); return true; case 15004: sendOptionDialogue(player, new int[]{15005, -1}, "I'd like to be teleported.", "Nah I'll walk."); return true; case 15005: player.getSettings().getSpeakingTo().getNPC().forceText("Sentiato Lumbridge!"); TeleportHandler.telePlayer(player, 3207, 3159, 0, 4, 1, false); return true; case 15100: sendOptionDialogue(player, new int[]{15101, 15102, 15103, 15104}, "Dungeoneering", "Herblore", "Construction", "Farming"); return true; case 15101: player.getSkills().addExperience(Skills.DUNGEONEERING, 50000); return true; case 15102: player.getSkills().addExperience(Skills.HERBLORE, 50000); return true; case 15103: player.getSkills().addExperience(Skills.CONSTRUCTION, 50000); return true; case 15104: player.getSkills().addExperience(Skills.FARMING, 50000); return true;

After they recieve exp I don’t want them to be able to do the quest again
How would I do that

Read full topic
